priorVersion.title: CDISC Questionnaire RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C113862

self.title: CDISC Questionnaire RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 Test Code Terminology

name: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 Questionnaire Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 Test Code Terminology
synonyms: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 Questionnaire Test Code

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - In general, would you say your health is:
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Rate Your Health
synonyms: R3601-Would You Say Your Health Is

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Rate Your Health Compared to One Year Ago
synonyms: R3601-Health Now Compared to 1 Year Ago

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, participating in strenuous sports.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Vigorous Activities

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Moderate activities, such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, or playing golf.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Moderate Activities

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Lifting or carrying groceries.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Lifting Groceries

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Climbing several flights of stairs.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Climbing Several Flights

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Climbing one flight of stairs.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Climbing One Flight

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Bending, kneeling, or stooping.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Bending or Stooping

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Walking more than a mile.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Walking More Than A Mile
synonyms: R3601-Health Limit Walk More Than Mile

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Walking several blocks.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Walking Several Blocks

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Walking one block.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Walking One Block

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - Does your health now limit you in these activities: Bathing or dressing yourself.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Health Limit Bathing or Dressing

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health: Cut down the amount of time you spent on work or other activities.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Physical Health Cut Down Time Spent on Work

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health: Accomplished less than you would like.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Physical Health Accomplished Less

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health: Were limited in the kind of work or other activities.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Physical Health Limited in the Kind of Work
synonyms: R3601-Phys Health: Limit Kind of Work

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health: Had difficulty performing the work or other activities.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Physical Health Difficulty Performing Work

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems: Cut down the amount of time you spent on work or other activities.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Emotional Problem Cut Down Time Spent on Work

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems: Accomplished less than you would like.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Emotional Problem Accomplished Less

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems: Didn't do work or other activities as carefully as usual.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Emotional Problem Did Not Do Work as Carefully

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, to what extent has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your normal social activities with family, friends, neighbors, or groups?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Extend Physical Health or Emotional Problems Interfere With Social Activities

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much bodily pain have you had during the past 4 weeks?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Bodily Pain
synonyms: R3601-How Much Bodily Pain Have You Had

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, how much did pain interfere with your normal work?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Pain Interfere With Normal Work
synonyms: R3601-Did Pain Interfere With Your Work

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Did you feel full of pep?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Feel Full of Pep
synonyms: R3601-Did You Feel Full of Pep

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Have you been a very nervous person?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Been a Nervous Person
synonyms: R3601-Have Been a Very Nervous Person

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Have you felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer you up?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Felt Nothing Could Cheer You Up
synonyms: R3601-Have Felt So Down in the Dumps

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Have you felt calm and peaceful?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Felt Calm and Peaceful
synonyms: R3601-Have You Felt Calm and Peaceful

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Did you have a lot of energy?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Have a Lot of Energy
synonyms: R3601-Did You Have a Lot of Energy

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Have you felt downhearted and blue?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Felt Downhearted and Blue

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Did you feel worn out?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Feel Worn Out

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Have you been a happy person?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Been a Happy Person
synonyms: R3601-Have You Been a Happy Person

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How much of the time during the past 4 weeks: Did you feel tired?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Feel Tired

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities?
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Time Physical Health or Emotional Problems Interfere With Social Activities

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you: I seem to get sick a little easier than other people.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Get Sick Easier Than Other
synonyms: R3601-Get Sick Easier Than Other People

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you: I am as healthy as anybody I know.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - As Healthy as Anybody
synonyms: R3601-I Am as Healthy as Anybody I Know

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you: I expect my health to get worse.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - Expect Health to Get Worse
synonyms: R3601-I Expect My Health to Get Worse

terms.definition: RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0 - How TRUE or FALSE is each of the following statements for you: My health is excellent.
terms.preferredTerm: RAND-36 - My Health is Excellent
